info.description: Assess, monitor, manage, and remediate security issues across your AWS infrastructure, applications, and data.
info.title: Amazon GuardDuty

get.description: Lists detectorIds of all the existing Amazon GuardDuty detector resources.

post.description: Creates a single Amazon GuardDuty detector. A detector is an object that represents the GuardDuty service. A detector must be created in order for GuardDuty to become operational.

delete.description: Deletes a Amazon GuardDuty detector specified by the detector ID.

get.description: Retrieves an Amazon GuardDuty detector specified by the detectorId.

post.description: Updates an Amazon GuardDuty detector specified by the detectorId.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of the current filters.

post.description: Creates a filter using the specified finding criteria.

delete.description: Deletes the filter specified by the filter name.

get.description: Returns the details of the filter specified by the filter name.

post.description: Updates the filter specified by the filter name.
Lists Amazon GuardDuty findings for the specified detector ID.
Archives Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by the list of finding IDs.
Generates example findings of types specified by the list of finding types. If 'NULL' is specified for findingTypes, the API generates example findings of all supported finding types.
Marks specified Amazon GuardDuty findings as useful or not useful.
Describes Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by finding IDs.
Lists Amazon GuardDuty findings' statistics for the specified detector ID.
Unarchives Amazon GuardDuty findings specified by the list of finding IDs.

get.description: Lists the IPSets of the GuardDuty service specified by the detector ID.

post.description: Creates a new IPSet - a list of trusted IP addresses that have been whitelisted for secure communication with AWS infrastructure and applications.

delete.description: Deletes the IPSet specified by the IPSet ID.

get.description: Retrieves the IPSet specified by the IPSet ID.

post.description: Updates the IPSet specified by the IPSet ID.

get.description: Provides the details for the GuardDuty master account to the current GuardDuty member account.

post.description: Accepts the invitation to be monitored by a master GuardDuty account.
Disassociates the current GuardDuty member account from its master account.

get.description: Lists details about all member accounts for the current GuardDuty master account.

post.description: Creates member accounts of the current AWS account by specifying a list of AWS account IDs. The current AWS account can then invite these members to manage GuardDuty in their accounts.
Deletes GuardDuty member accounts (to the current GuardDuty master account) specified by the account IDs.
Disassociates GuardDuty member accounts (to the current GuardDuty master account) specified by the account IDs.
Retrieves GuardDuty member accounts (to the current GuardDuty master account) specified by the account IDs.

Invites other AWS accounts (created as members of the current AWS account by CreateMembers) to enable GuardDuty and allow the current AWS account to view and manage these accounts' GuardDuty findings on their behalf as the master account.

Re-enables GuardDuty to monitor findings of the member accounts specified by the account IDs. A master GuardDuty account can run this command after disabling GuardDuty from monitoring these members' findings by running StopMonitoringMembers.

Disables GuardDuty from monitoring findings of the member accounts specified by the account IDs. After running this command, a master GuardDuty account can run StartMonitoringMembers to re-enable GuardDuty to monitor these members’ findings.

get.description: Lists the ThreatIntelSets of the GuardDuty service specified by the detector ID.

post.description: Create a new ThreatIntelSet. ThreatIntelSets consist of known malicious IP addresses. GuardDuty generates findings based on ThreatIntelSets.

delete.description: Deletes ThreatIntelSet specified by the ThreatIntelSet ID.

get.description: Retrieves the ThreatIntelSet that is specified by the ThreatIntelSet ID.

post.description: Updates the ThreatIntelSet specified by ThreatIntelSet ID.

get.description: Lists all GuardDuty membership invitations that were sent to the current AWS account.
Returns the count of all GuardDuty membership invitations that were sent to the current member account except the currently accepted invitation.

post.description: Declines invitations sent to the current member account by AWS account specified by their account IDs.
Deletes invitations sent to the current member account by AWS accounts specified by their account IDs.

InvitationId.description: This value is used to validate the master account to the member account.

MasterId.description: The account ID of the master GuardDuty account whose invitation you're accepting.

AccessKeyDetails.description: The IAM access key details (IAM user information) of a user that engaged in the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

AccessKeyId.description: Access key ID of the user.

PrincipalId.description: The principal ID of the user.

AccountDetail.description: An object containing the member's accountId and email address.

Action.description: Information about the activity described in a finding.

AwsApiCallAction.description: Information about the AWS_API_CALL action described in this finding.

DnsRequestAction.description: Information about the DNS_REQUEST action described in this finding.

NetworkConnectionAction.description: Information about the NETWORK_CONNECTION action described in this finding.

PortProbeAction.description: Information about the PORT_PROBE action described in this finding.

Activate.description: Whether we should start processing the list immediately or not.

FindingIds.description: IDs of the findings that you want to archive.

AwsApiCallAction.description: Information about the AWS_API_CALL action described in this finding.

DomainDetails.description: Domain information for the AWS API call.

RemoteIpDetails.description: Remote IP information of the connection.

ServiceName.description: AWS service name whose API was invoked.

City.description: City information of the remote IP address.

CityName.description: City name of the remote IP address.

Comments.description: Additional feedback about the GuardDuty findings.

Condition.description: Finding attribute (for example, accountId) for which conditions and values must be specified when querying findings.

Eq.description: Represents the equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

Gt.description: Represents the greater than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

Gte.description: Represents the greater than equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

Lt.description: Represents the less than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

Lte.description: Represents the less than equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

Neq.description: Represents the not equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

CountBySeverityFindingStatistic.description: The count of findings for the given severity.

Country.description: Country information of the remote IP address.

CountryCode.description: Country code of the remote IP address.

CountryName.description: Country name of the remote IP address.

ClientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

Enable.description: A boolean value that specifies whether the detector is to be enabled.

FindingPublishingFrequency.description: A enum value that specifies how frequently customer got Finding updates published.

DetectorId.description: The unique ID of the created detector.

Action.description: Specifies the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

ClientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

FindingCriteria.description: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for querying findings.

Rank.description: Specifies the position of the filter in the list of current filters. Also specifies the order in which this filter is applied to the findings.

Name.description: The name of the successfully created filter.

Activate.description: A boolean value that indicates whether GuardDuty is to start using the uploaded IPSet.

ClientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

Format.description: The format of the file that contains the IPSet.

Location.description: The URI of the file that contains the IPSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key)

Name.description: The user friendly name to identify the IPSet. This name is displayed in all findings that are triggered by activity that involves IP addresses included in this IPSet.

AccountDetails.description: A list of account ID and email address pairs of the accounts that you want to associate with the master GuardDuty account.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

FindingTypes.description: Types of sample findings that you want to generate.

Activate.description: A boolean value that indicates whether GuardDuty is to start using the uploaded ThreatIntelSet.

ClientToken.description: The idempotency token for the create request.

Format.description: The format of the file that contains the ThreatIntelSet.

Location.description: The URI of the file that contains the ThreatIntelSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key).

Name.description: A user-friendly ThreatIntelSet name that is displayed in all finding generated by activity that involves IP addresses included in this ThreatIntelSet.

CreatedAt.description: The first time a resource was created. The format will be ISO-8601.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the AWS accounts that sent invitations to the current member account that you want to decline invitations from.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the AWS accounts that sent invitations to the current member account that you want to delete invitations from.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to delete.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

DetectorId.description: The unique identifier for a detector.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to disassociate from master.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

DnsRequestAction.description: Information about the DNS_REQUEST action described in this finding.

Domain.description: Domain information for the DNS request.

DomainDetails.description: Domain information for the AWS API call.

Enable.description: A boolean value that specifies whether the detector is to be enabled.

Eq.description: Represents the equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for findings.

FilterAction.description: The action associated with a filter.

FilterName.description: The unique identifier for a filter

FilterRank.description: Relative position of filter among list of exisiting filters.

Finding.description: Representation of a abnormal or suspicious activity.

AccountId.description: AWS account ID where the activity occurred that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

Arn.description: The ARN of a finding described by the action.

Confidence.description: The confidence level of a finding.

CreatedAt.description: The time stamp at which a finding was generated.

Id.description: The identifier that corresponds to a finding described by the action.

Region.description: The AWS region where the activity occurred that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

Resource.description: The AWS resource associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

Service.description: Additional information assigned to the generated finding by GuardDuty.

Type.description: The type of a finding described by the action.

UpdatedAt.description: The time stamp at which a finding was last updated.

FindingCriteria.description: Represents the criteria used for querying findings.

Criterion.description: Represents a map of finding properties that match specified conditions and values when querying findings.

FindingId.description: The unique identifier for the Finding

FindingPublishingFrequency.description: A enum value that specifies how frequently customer got Finding updates published.

FindingStatisticTypes.description: The list of the finding statistics.

CountBySeverity.description: Represents a map of severity to count statistic for a set of findings

FindingType.description: The finding type for the finding

FindingTypes.description: The list of the finding types.

GeoLocation.description: Location information of the remote IP address.

Lat.description: Latitude information of remote IP address.

Lon.description: Longitude information of remote IP address.

Action.description: Specifies the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

FindingCriteria.description: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for querying findings.

Rank.description: Specifies the position of the filter in the list of current filters. Also specifies the order in which this filter is applied to the findings.

FindingIds.description: IDs of the findings that you want to retrieve.

SortCriteria.description: Represents the criteria used for sorting findings.

FindingCriteria.description: Represents the criteria used for querying findings.

FindingStatisticTypes.description: Types of finding statistics to retrieve.

Format.description: The format of the file that contains the IPSet.

Location.description: The URI of the file that contains the IPSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key)

Name.description: The user friendly name to identify the IPSet. This name is displayed in all findings that are triggered by activity that involves IP addresses included in this IPSet.

Status.description: The status of ipSet file uploaded.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to describe.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

Location.description: The URI of the file that contains the ThreatIntelSet. For example (https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/my-bucket/my-object-key).

Name.description: A user-friendly ThreatIntelSet name that is displayed in all finding generated by activity that involves IP addresses included in this ThreatIntelSet.

Status.description: The status of threatIntelSet file uploaded.

IamInstanceProfile.description: The profile information of the EC2 instance.

InstanceDetails.description: The information about the EC2 instance associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

AvailabilityZone.description: The availability zone of the EC2 instance.

ImageDescription.description: The image description of the EC2 instance.

ImageId.description: The image ID of the EC2 instance.

InstanceId.description: The ID of the EC2 instance.

InstanceState.description: The state of the EC2 instance.

InstanceType.description: The type of the EC2 instance.

LaunchTime.description: The launch time of the EC2 instance.

NetworkInterfaces.description: The network interface information of the EC2 instance.

Platform.description: The platform of the EC2 instance.

ProductCodes.description: The product code of the EC2 instance.

Tags.description: The tags of the EC2 instance.

Invitation.description: Invitation from an AWS account to become the current account's master.

InvitationId.description: This value is used to validate the inviter account to the member account.

InvitedAt.description: Timestamp at which the invitation was sent

RelationshipStatus.description: The status of the relationship between the inviter and invitee accounts.

InvitationId.description: This value is used to validate the master account to the member account.

AccountIds.description: A list of account IDs of the accounts that you want to invite to GuardDuty as members.

DisableEmailNotification.description: A boolean value that specifies whether you want to disable email notification to the accounts that you’re inviting to GuardDuty as members.

Message.description: The invitation message that you want to send to the accounts that you’re inviting to GuardDuty as members.

UnprocessedAccounts.description: A list of objects containing the unprocessed account and a result string explaining why it was unprocessed.

InvitedAt.description: Timestamp at which a member has been invited. The format will be ISO-8601.

IpSetId.description: The unique identifier for an IP Set

IpSetIds.description: A list of the IP set IDs

IpSetStatus.description: The status of ipSet file uploaded.

Ipv6Address.description: IpV6 address of the EC2 instance.

Ipv6Addresses.description: A list of EC2 instance IPv6 address information.

FindingCriteria.description: Represents the criteria used for querying findings.

MaxResults.description: You can use this parameter to indicate the maximum number of items you want in the response. The default value is 50. The maximum value is 50.

NextToken.description: You can use this parameter when paginating results. Set the value of this parameter to null on your first call to the ListFindings action. For subsequent calls to the action fill nextToken in the request with the value of nextToken from the previous response to continue listing data.

SortCriteria.description: Represents the criteria used for sorting findings.

Action.description: Information about the activity described in a finding.

Archived.description: Indicates whether this finding is archived.

OrderBy.description: Order by which the sorted findings are to be displayed.
